David Kaplan}} 'David Kaplan' is the writer/director of several films based on
fairy tales and folklore, including the feature film [[Year of the Fish]]
(2008), which premiered at the 2007 Sundance Film Festival and was released
theatrically in 2008.

Kaplan has made several short films, including [[Little Red Riding Hood
(film)|Little Red Riding Hood]] (1997) starring Christina Ricci and Quentin
Crisp. His other short films include [[Little Suck-a-Thumb]], [[The Frog King
(1994 film)|The Frog King]] (1995 Sundance Film Festival), and LoveDeath,
commissioned for Lincoln Centerâs 2003 New York Video Festival.

His second feature film is [[Today's Special (2009 film)|Today's Special]]
(2009), a comedy set in an Indian restaurant in Jackson Heights, Queens,
starring Aasif Mandvi ([[The Daily Show]]), Madhur Jaffrey ([[Shakespeare-
Wallah]]) and legendary Bollywood actor Naseeruddin Shah ([[Monsoon Wedding]]).
